articles.title: PM Modi, S Jaishankar Receive Lionel Messi's Jersey
articles.description: PM Modi had also congratulated Argentina on winning the FIFA 2022 World Cup, stating that millions of Indians are celebrating the victory of Argentina and Lionel Messi.
articles.content:
Pablo Gonzalez, President YPF from Argentina gifted a Lionel Messi t-shirt to PM Modi while Minister of S&T and Innovation of Argentina Filmus Daniel handed over the star striker's t-shirt to Jaishankar. (Photo: Twitter)

articles.title: YPF to target $1B in financing this year, chairman says
articles.description: Argentina's YPF (YPF) aims to raise ~$1B in financing in 2023, returning to debt markets to fund development of the Vaca Muerta shale region, Chairman Pablo Gonzalez told Reuters on Monday
articles.content:
Argentina's YPF (NYSE:YPF) aims to raise ~$1B in financing in 2023, returning to debt markets to fund development of the Vaca Muerta shale region, Chairman Pablo Gonzalez told Reuters on Monday.
The money likely would fund ~20% of a $5B investment pl... [814 chars]

articles.title: ONGC to explore investing in Argentina gas assets
articles.description: Oil and Natural Gas Corp Ltd will explore opportunities investing in gas assets in Argentina. The company also signed an MoU with Argentina's state oil company YPF for hydrocarbon operation
articles.content:
India's state-run Oil and Natural Gas Corp Ltd will explore investing in gas assets in Argentina, its chairman said on Tuesday.
The company also signed a memorandum of understanding with Argentina's state oil company YPF for hydrocarbon cooperation.

articles.title: PM Narendra Modi receives Lionel Messi Argentina jersey replica as gift
articles.description: Modi had congratulated Argentina and Messi after they had won the World Cup in Qatar after beating France in a thrilling final.
articles.content:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was gifted a Lionel Messi jersey by Pablo Gonzalez, the president of YPF from Argentina on the sidelines of the India Energy Week in Bengaluru.

articles.title: Hot, dry weather threaten further yield reductions in Argentina
articles.description: For the major soybean-producing regions of Argentina, this was the eight driest end to January and start to February in 30+ years, according to data from WeatherTrends360.
articles.content: Hopes of appreciable rain in Argentina in the week-ending Feb. 4, 2023, were largely dashed with precipitation concentrated in northwestern portions of the country. For the major soybean-producing regions, this was the eight driest end to January and... [2220 chars]
